title: Forager Cycles Link Wrenches are Now CNC Milled in House
content:
Ever-chasing perfection, Forager Cycles purchased a new CNC mill late last year in an attempt to fine-tune its in-house production. The Link Wrench was laser cut and etched prior, which resulted in slag-covered products and tolerances not as tight as Forager would like. Now, the Link Wrench is CNC milled in-house, from Grade 5 titanium, which allows for even tighter tolerances (your old Link Wrench is still just fine, weâ€™re talking machinist OCD here with tolerances!)

These wrenches are super handy for tightening 8, 9, or 10 mm nuts down on the trail. Be it fenders, racks, faux-racks/bag supports, and the Dyneema chord can be used as a chain Masterlink tool, even!

Check out the new CNC milled Link Wrench at Forager Cycles.

The post Forager Cycles Link Wrenches are Now CNC Milled in House appeared first on The Radavist.
author: John Watson
